topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542783e96368720cb10d0100#post_542783e96368720cb10d0100
[bq="Too_Offensive"]you know how video game companies would take jabs at each other in their ads back in the 90's? 

I just realized that cell phone companies are all over that shit at the moment. Although it seems less fun and more douchey now. [/bq]
I'll explain this quickly cause chances are you probably already guessed why this is:
Short version is that base functionality wise there's no real reason to get the latest Iphone so they have to resort to being dicks to other companies to sell themselves.
"Oh you don't need the latest Iphone6?  That sounds like a dirty blackberry traitor would say" :V
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Or something

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542786fa6368720f6a520100#post_542786fa6368720f6a520100
actually from what I've seen, it's usually apple's competitors pulling that type of thing. Samsung, windows and whoever else. it's always "You think the iphone is neat? well check this shit out!" 

another thing that gets me is this new trend of MASSIVE cell phones. I get it, when you phone is a multimedia device you want it to have an easily viewed screen but carrying around a thin, broad piece of aluminum and glass in your pocket seems horribly impractical. I'm surprised we're only now seeing them breaking with the new iphones.

da. Even I know that and I am pretty much illiterate tech wise[/bq]
A lot of technology has booms and busts; most of the time from extreme stupidity though.

Prime example of extreme stupidity coming up: Windows 9 will be paid subscription and SteamOS is coming out the same time; Microsoft keeps going on about how their idea for a paid subscription for a operating system is genius thinking people would love to have pay a subscription to use a operating system.

Call me crazy but I have a feeling that Microsoft is about to have a bad time.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54278b3c63687257d4d80000#post_54278b3c63687257d4d80000
It's been known about for a while, but essentially what Microsoft plans on doing with Windows 9 is switching it from their current model to where you have to have a subscription in order to use Windows.  The reason why I'm getting so much popcorn ready for this is that SteamOS comes out the same month; in order for Windows 9 to be subscription based the person buying Windows or buying a new computer must have a internet connection to validate their copy of windows to continue to use their computer.

You know how everyone thought windows 8 was shit?  Well windows 9 is probably going to be the god of shit.

I'm going to laugh so hard when Windows 9 comes out.
